conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_A and I’m formally applying. School_A is my first-choice school because I’m especially interested in your academic environment and would be excited to contribute to the community. If offered a seat, I will accept and enroll. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice immediately. School_A is #1 on my true list, and I have relatively strong priority there (3rd). Even though Student_B has higher priority at School_A and may also apply, early application maximizes my chance; if rejected, I can pivot next round to School_C where my priority is low, so delaying doesn’t help.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. After careful consideration, we are not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your time and wish you the very best with your other applications.
conversation.thought: Student_A is applying in round 1 and ranks School_A first, so acceptance would lock in a solid match. However, on School_A’s true priority list, Student_A is 3rd behind Student_B and Student_D. Given full information: Student_B ranks School_A 3rd (after School_B, School_D) and Student_D ranks School_A 2nd (after School_C). So Student_D is a realistic higher-priority candidate who may apply to School_A if rejected by School_C, and Student_B could also come later if not admitted to School_B/School_D. With quota 1, accepting Student_A now risks missing Student_D (higher priority and plausibly attainable). Therefore reject Student_A to preserve the seat for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: School_B is my first-choice school, and I’m applying as my top preference. If admitted, I will definitely accept and enroll. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Even though School_B ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_A), applying in round 1 gives me the best chance to secure my first choice before the seat is taken. I will express strong commitment to encourage acceptance if they are considering close candidates.

conversation.message: Thank you for your strong interest in School_B and for applying. After reviewing our priorities and limited quota, we’re unable to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your application and wish you the best with your other choices.
conversation.thought: Student_B is applying now and ranks 3rd on our true priority list (D, A, B, C, E). We have quota 1. If we accept B immediately, we forgo the chance to match with Student_D or Student_A, who are higher priority and may plausibly be available: Student_D prefers School_C then A then B, so D might not end at B, but could if rejected by C/A. Student_A ranks B 4th, so less likely to come. Given we can only respond ACCEPT/REJECT to an APPLY, and holding is not allowed, the strategic choice is to reject now to preserve the seat for higher-priority candidates, accepting the risk of ending unmatched. Since B is still on our list, but not top, we prioritize the option value of waiting for D/A.

conversation.message: School_D is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I’m highly motivated to join your community and would commit immediately if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), behind Student_D and Student_E. Since capacity is 1 and competition is likely, I should apply immediately rather than wait and risk losing the seat. I will emphasize that School_D is my first choice and I would commit if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_D is your first choice. After reviewing applications this round, we’re not able to offer you a place at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_D and wish you the very best with your other applications.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority list is D > E > C > B > A. In this round I received [APPLY] from Student_C and Student_E. Student_E is ranked above Student_C on my list, and both are willing to commit if accepted. With quota 1, accepting Student_C now would prevent me from matching with the higher-priority Student_E. There is no indication that Student_E is unavailable or unlikely to accept, so the optimal move to maximize my outcome is to reject Student_C and preserve the seat for Student_E.

conversation.message: Dear School_D admissions, I’m Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_D and believe I would be a strong fit for your program and community. I’d like to formally apply and would be excited to accept a place if offered.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind Student_C, Student_B, Student_D). Those higher-priority students are likely to apply there early, so an immediate [APPLY] risks quick rejection and wastes the round. My second choice School_B ranks me last, so it’s also unlikely. School_A ranks me 4th as well. School_D ranks me 2nd (after Student_D), making it my best realistic path to secure a high placement. Since Student_D’s first choice is School_C (not School_D), there’s a strong chance School_D will accept me if I apply now. I will apply to School_D to lock in a solid match rather than gamble on School_C.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and your interest in School_D. We’re pleased to offer you admission.

Please confirm your acceptance through this match.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority ranks Student_D first, then Student_E, then Student_C. In this round I have applications from Student_C and Student_E. Student_E is higher on my priority list than Student_C, and I previously rejected Student_C. With quota 1, accepting Student_E now secures my second-choice overall and avoids the risk of ending unmatched if Student_D never applies. Student_E also lists School_D as 4th choice, but an [APPLY] indicates willingness to match if accepted, so I should accept immediately.

conversation.message: School_C is my first choice. I’m applying because I strongly want to enroll and would accept an offer immediately if admitted. I’m especially interested in your academic environment and would be excited to contribute and commit to School_C.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), so it’s plausible to secure a seat if I apply immediately before higher-priority students lock it up. I’ll apply now and clearly express commitment to reduce the chance they hold out for others.

conversation.message: Thank you for applying, Student_D. We appreciate that School_C is your first choice and your clear commitment to enroll. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_D is 3rd on School_C’s true priority list (after Student_C and Student_B). However, Student_C ranks School_C 4th and Student_B ranks School_C 5th, so they are unlikely to apply here early (or at all) unless rejected elsewhere. Student_D ranks School_C 1st and has applied with a strong commitment, making an immediate secure match likely. With quota 1 and no other applicants this round, accepting Student_D maximizes the chance of filling the seat with a relatively high-priority student rather than waiting for higher-priority students who may never come.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions Committee, I’m Student_A and I’m formally applying for admission. I’m excited by School_B’s academic rigor and would value the opportunity to contribute to your community. If offered a seat, I will accept and enroll. Thank you very much for your consideration.
conversation.thought: School_A already rejected me and has higher-priority candidates (B and D) likely to apply, so reapplying is unlikely to succeed. School_B is my 4th choice but I have relatively strong priority there (2nd after Student_D). Since School_C and School_D are already matched, the best remaining chance to secure a decent outcome is to apply to School_B now before it fills, emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. We’re pleased to offer you admission. We would be excited to have you join our community.

[ACTION: ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and true priority order D > A > B > C > E. Student_A is my 2nd-choice overall and has now formally applied with commitment to enroll. I already rejected Student_B (ranked below A). While Student_D is my top priority, they have not contacted me and they rank School_B as their 3rd choice behind School_C and School_A, so waiting risks ending unmatched or settling for a lower-priority student later. Accepting Student_A now secures a high-priority match within quota.

conversation.message:
Dear School_A Admissions,

I’m Student_C and I would like to formally apply to School_A. After reflecting on my goals for high school, I believe your academic environment and community would be an excellent fit for me. If offered a seat, I am ready to accept promptly and would be excited to commit to School_A.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_C
conversation.thought: School_D (my top choice) already rejected me. Among remaining unmatched schools, School_A is my next highest true preference. Although School_A ranks me last in its priority list, I should still apply now because waiting risks losing the only remaining higher-ranked options; School_B and School_E are lower on my list. I will send a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_A. After reviewing your application in the context of this year’s process, we are not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate the time you took to apply and wish you the very best with your other applications.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and true priority order: B > D > A > E > C. In this round, both Student_B and Student_C applied. Student_B is School_A's top choice, while Student_C is last on the list. Accepting Student_C now would foreclose matching with Student_B. Therefore, reject Student_C to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates (notably Student_B).

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions Committee, I’m Student_B and I would like to formally apply. School_A is one of my top choices, and if offered admission I will accept and enroll. I believe I can contribute strongly to your academic community, and I would be grateful for your consideration.
conversation.thought: School_B (my top choice) already rejected me, likely because higher-priority applicants are in play. Among remaining unmatched schools, School_A is my 3rd choice and I have highest priority at School_A, giving me an excellent chance to secure a strong outcome immediately. I will apply directly and credibly signal commitment to enroll if admitted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and received APPLY from Student_B and Student_C this round. On School_A true priority list, Student_B is ranked #1 (highest), while Student_C is ranked last (#5). Student_B also states they will accept and enroll if offered. Accepting Student_B immediately secures our top-choice match and dominates any alternative; there is no benefit to waiting. Therefore accept Student_B and fill quota.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions,

My name is Student_C and I would like to formally apply to School_E. While I have explored other options earlier in the process, I have reflected carefully and I believe School_E would be a strong fit for me academically and personally. If offered admission, I am ready to accept promptly and commit.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_C
conversation.thought: Only School_E remains unmatched this round, and it is on my true preference list (though ranked 5th). Since I have already been rejected by School_D and School_A and there are no other available schools to approach, the best strategy to avoid being left unmatched is to apply to School_E now and signal strong commitment if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your thoughtful application to School_E. We appreciate your interest and are pleased to offer you admission. If you are ready to commit as indicated, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_C is #2 on School_E’s true priority list (behind Student_A). We have quota 1 and currently no match. Student_C has formally applied and signals readiness to commit. Waiting for Student_A is risky because Student_A ranks School_E last and is unlikely to apply; other students also rank School_E low. Accepting Student_C secures a high-priority match now rather than risking ending unmatched or with a lower-priority student later.
